page.title: 15Fishing on the River Coquet.
page.content: Fishing is a popular pastime on the River Coquet between Guyzance and Warkworth.Anglers exercise their expertise to catch salmon and trout.The salmon season lasts from February until October and the trout season from mid March until September. Traditionally,the first salmon caught is presented to the local landowner, His Grace The Duke of Northumberland. Anglers use various bait but the most popular are artificial flies made from feathers and hair,particular favourites are Greenwells Glory and Partridge and Orange. Many anglers prefer to tie their own flies butthey can be bought commercially.Fine quality fishing tackle is manufactured locally by Hardy Bros.in nearby Alnwick.Bailiffs are employed to monitor fish stock and to prevent illegal fishing.
